question: What is the purpose of a context switch in an operating system?

answers.answer: To save the CPU state for a process
answers.feedback: Incorrect. While saving the CPU state is part of a context switch, it is not the primary purpose of a context switch.

answers.answer: To capture the process state for later retrieval
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Capturing the process state is necessary for a context switch, but not the primary purpose of a context switch.

answers.answer: To add a layer of indirection between the CPU and the user
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Adding a layer of indirection is a concept related to virtualizing, but not the primary purpose of a context switch.

answers.answer: To change the active process on a CPU
answers.feedback: Correct! A context switch is performed to change the active process on a CPU.

question: Which are NOT valid transitions in the process life cycle?

answers.answer: ready -> running
answers.feedback: Incorrect. A process can transition from ready to running.

answers.answer: ready -> blocked
answers.feedback: Correct!. A process cannot transition from ready to blocked.

answers.answer: running -> ready
answers.feedback: Incorrect. A process can transition from running to ready.

answers.answer: running -> blocked
answers.feedback: Incorrect. A process can transition from running to blocked.

answers.answer: blocked -> ready
answers.feedback: Incorrect. A process can transition from blocked to ready.

answers.answer: blocked -> running
answers.feedback: Correct!. A process cannot transition from blocked to running.

answers.answer: A child process becomes a zombie when parent process exits before a child process exits
answers.feedback: Incorrect. In that case, the child becomes an orphan. A child becomes a zombie when it exits before the parent calls a wait syscall.

answers.answer: A variable change in a child process will be reflected in its parent process
answers.feedback: Incorrect. A forked process will have its memory space duplicated, independent to the parent's memory.

answers.answer: The variables and their addresses in a forked process are the same as the ones in the parent process (excluding fork() return value)
answers.feedback: Correct! A forked process' virtual address space is an exact copy to its parent's.

answers.answer: Processes cannot communicate with eachother because of their separate address spaces
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Process can communicate through pipes and file descriptors.

answers.answer: Multithreading independent threads will make the process execute faster
answers.feedback: Incorrect. It is actually slower to multithread because of the time used to perform a context switch.

answers.answer: Threads can see other threads' local variables and addresses
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Although they share the same address space, their view is still limited to their scope

answers.answer: A blocked thread is immediately skipped or not considered when it gets scheduled
answers.feedback: Correct! A blocked thread is usually waiting to receive data, and will not waste CPU time waiting for that data.

answers.answer: If the main thread exits, the other threads continue until completion
answers.feedback: Incorrect. If the main thread exits (main function returns), all other threads exit aswell.

answers.answer: Assuming all processes are finite, batch scheduling is slower than preemptive scheduling
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Although used for early computers, Batch scheduling is faster because time is not used performing as many context switches.

answers.answer: Preemptive scheduling has better turnaround time than batch
answers.feedback: Correct!

answers.answer: Shortest Job First (SJF) and priority scheduling can lead to starvation
answers.feedback: Correct! A flury of short jobs and high priority jobs can starve the long jobs and low priority jobs from running.

answers.answer: More frequent scheduling means all processes execute faster
answers.feedback: Incorrect. More frequent scheduling means more time is being spent performing a context switch than progressing the task.
